Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is regressive and likened to returning to 'serfdom'.
Concerns about who defines misinformation, suggesting it will be decided by bureaucrats without public input.
The legislation is viewed as a threat to free speech, allowing censorship by bureaucrats and politicians.
The individual believes they are capable of discerning information without government intervention.
The proposal is seen as a tool for the government to silence opposition and control media narratives.
The submission argues there is no justification for the legislation and that current measures are sufficient.
Main Themes: Lack of justification for new powers
Notable Quotes: Your new proposed powers are not putting Australia in the forefront. Just the opposite, taking us back to serfdom.
The proposal smacks of a means by which government can silence opposition and criticism and favour those media which will 'kowtow to the party line'.
